[1]:

import xarray as xr

import shnitsel as st
import shnitsel.xarray

xr.set_options(
    display_expand_coords=False,
    display_expand_data_vars=False,
    display_expand_attrs=False,
    display_expand_data=False
)

[1]:

<xarray.core.options.set_options at 0x7991f031f8f0>

We first load the data for retinal (I02) from the test data folder:

[ ]:

compound = st.io.read('./test_data/shnitsel/traj_I02.nc')

Dihedrals for all#

Let us calculate all dihedrals for all trajetories

[9]:

from shnitsel.geo.geocalc import get_dihedrals
dt_dihedrals = get_dihedrals(compound, structure_selection='[#6,#1][#6]=[#6,#7][#6,#1]', deg=True, signed=True)

We can stack them into a single dataset that we can then visualize as a pandas dataframe

[10]:

dihedrals = dt_dihedrals.as_stacked
dih_df = dihedrals.to_pandas()
dih_df

[11]:

from shnitsel.vis.colormaps import st_blue,st_grey, st_yellow, st_violet, st_orange, st_pink
colors = dict(
    st_grey = st_grey,
    st_yellow = st_yellow,
    st_violet = st_violet,
    st_blue = st_blue,
    st_orange = st_orange,
    st_pink = st_pink,
)

[12]:

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
shnitsel_colors = type(plt.get_cmap('tab10'))(colors.values())

[8]:

for (name, compound), color in zip(dih_df.groupby('compound'), colors.values()):
    plt.hist(compound['atXYZ'], label=name, color=color, density=True, alpha=.5, bins=20)
    plt.hist(compound['atXYZ'], histtype='step', color=color, density=True, fill=False, bins=20)
plt.legend()
plt.xlabel('angle / Â°')
plt.ylabel('density')
plt.title(r"$\phi_{(C|H)C=(C|N)(C|H)}$ at S$_1\to$S$_0$ hops")
plt.savefig('/nc/reports/2026-01-13_hop_distributions/all_dihedrals.pdf')

Pyramidalizations for all#

[9]:

from shnitsel.geo import analogs
combined = analogs.combine_analogs(compounds.values(), '[#6,#1][#6]=[#6,#7]([#1])[#6,#1]', list(compounds))

[10]:

combined.mol

[10]:

[11]:

pyr_all = combined.atXYZ.st.get_pyramids(deg=True).squeeze('descriptor')

[16]:

# For I01: pyramidalizations at hops from S2 -> S1
pyr_I01 = pyr_all[{'frame': pyr_all.compound=='I01'}].st.hops('3->2')
pyr_others = pyr_all[{'frame': pyr_all.compound!='I01'}].st.hops('2->1')
pyr = xr.concat([pyr_I01, pyr_others], dim='frame')
pyr

[23]:

# fig, axs = plt.subplots(2, 1, layout='constrained', sharex=True)
for (name, compound), color in zip(pyr_df.groupby('compound'), colors.values()):
    # if name=='A03': continue
    plt.hist(compound['atXYZ'], label=name, color=color, density=True, alpha=.5, bins=20)
    plt.hist(compound['atXYZ'], histtype='step', color=color, density=True, fill=False, bins=20)
plt.legend()
plt.xlabel('angle / Â°')
plt.ylabel('density')
plt.title(r"""Pyramidalization at hops
S$_2\to$S$_1$ for I01; S$_1\to$S$_0$ for alkenes""")
plt.savefig('/nc/reports/2026-01-13_hop_distributions/all_pyramids.pdf')
